title: Maximum Workshops
problem_statement:
Maximum Workshops

Problem Description

A university is hosting several workshops during a festival. Each workshop is represented by a pair [start, end], where start is the start time and end is the finish time (start < end).

An attendee wants to join the maximum number of workshops without overlaps.

  • If one workshop ends at the same time another begins, both can be attended.
  • Overlapping workshops cannot both be attended.

Write a function maxWorkshops that returns the maximum number of workshops that can be attended.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: intervals = [[0,30],[5,10],[15,20]]
Output: 3

Explanation: Skip the first workshop and attend the other three.

Example 2:

Input: intervals = [[5,8],[9,15]]
Output: 2

Explanation: These workshops do not overlap, so both can be attended.

Example 3:

Input: intervals = [[1,3],[2,4],[3,5],[7,8],[8,12]]
Output: 4

Explanation: Take the workshop (1,3), (3,5), (7,8) and (8,12).

Constraints

  • 0 <= intervals.length < 500
  • 0 <= interval[i].length == 2
  • 0 <= interval[i][0] < interval[i][1] < 1,000,000
const readline = require('readline');

const rl = readline.createInterface({
    input: process.stdin,
    output: process.stdout
});

function maxWorkshops(intervals) {
    // Enter Your Code Here
}

rl.on('line', (line) => {
    const intervals = JSON.parse(line);
    console.log(maxWorkshops(intervals));
    rl.close();
});
